title: Competency-Based Curriculum Design for Healthcare Professionals: Focused on Primary/Secondary Care Applications in Large-Scale Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and public health concepts
context.additional_context: Analysis of core competencies required in diverse healthcare service environments and cultivation of curriculum design capabilities that respond to community needs through case-based education.

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain at least three core task scopes of primary/secondary medical settings for healthcare professionals (doctors/nurses).
Learners will be able to specify competency-based learning objectives at five levels (Dreyfus Model) based on community healthcare demands.
Learners will be able to design two competency assessment tools (e.g., OSCE, portfolios) applicable to blended learning environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
